title: Center of mass - motion of projectile

content.question: A bar with a non-uniform density is launched from the ground with an initial center-of-mass speed <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> above the horizontal and lands at the same level from which it is launched as shown. The distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> is measured from right end of the bar when it is launched to the left end of the bar when it lands. During flight, the object experiences some rotation about its center of mass. Which of the following initial and final orientations of the bar’s center of mass <math alttext="x sub c m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>x</mi><mtext>cm</mtext></msub></math> would maximize <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>?

choices.label: Two figures are shown. The figure on the left is labeled “Initial Orientation,” and the figure on the right is labeled “Final Orientation.” Each figure shows a rectangle with length 3 units and width 13 units. A point labeled x sub c m is indicated inside each rectangle. For the initial orientation, the point is 3 units to the right of the left edge of the rectangle, and halfway between the top and bottom edges of the rectangle. For the final orientation, the point is 3 units to the right of the left edge of the rectangle, and halfway between the top and bottom edges of the rectangle.
